glsa.title: libwww-perl: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libwww-perl, the worst of which could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: libwww is a collection of Perl modules providing a consistent interface to the World-Wide Web.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in libwww-perl. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to download a specially-crafted file with an application linked against libwww-perl, which could result in overwritten files or arbitrary code execution by writing to a dotfile in the userâ€™s home directory (such as .bashrc). Additionally, a remote attacker could perform a Man-in-the-Middle attack.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All libwww-perl users should upgrade to the latest version:
NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since December 18, 2011. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.
